required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on Anticholinergic Use: Attribution of Overactive Bladder (OAB) Medications to the Anticholinergic Burden
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Database Analysis of Anticholinergic Burden Among the Elderly With and Without Overactive Bladder in Australia and South Korea

brief_summary.textblock: Outpatients with at least one dispensing record of any medication will be included in the study. An index date will be assigned to each participant and prescription records for anticholinergics will be used in the study.

primary_outcome.description: ACB will be calculated based on methodology from Campbell et al (2016). Sum (Drug A #days prescribed X ACB scale score) + (Drug B #days prescribed X ACB scale score) + (Drug Xâ€¦)/Number of days with any medication prescribed. The cumulative score has a range from 0 to infinity, with higher values indicating a higher cumulative anticholinergic burden of the patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Korea Specific: Percentage of Participants With any Listed Anticholinergic Use
primary_outcome.description: This will be calculated as number of participants with any listed anticholinergics use divided by number of participants fulfilling the general eligibility criteria of the study (in each study dataset) multiplied by 100.

primary_outcome.measure: Korea Specific: Percentage of Participants With Strong Anticholinergic Use
primary_outcome.description: This will be calculated as number of participants with strong anticholinergics use divided by number of participants fulfilling the general eligibility criteria of the study (in each study dataset) multiplied by 100.

primary_outcome.measure: Korea Specific: Number of Anticholinergics Dispensed per Participants
primary_outcome.description: This will be calculated as total number of anticholinergics dispensed divided by number of participants fulfilling the general eligibility criteria of the study (in each study dataset) multiplied by 100.

primary_outcome.measure: Korea Specific: Attribution Proportion of OAB medications to total ACB in OAB Cohort
primary_outcome.description: Attribution proportion of OAB medication to total ACB will be calculated as the ratio between the sum over all OAB patients of the ACB scores of each OAB medication multiplied by the number of days supply in the numerator and the sum over all OAB patients of the ACB scores of each antimuscarinic medication multiplied by the number of days supply in the denominator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median percentage of ACB score derived from overactive bladder (OAB) treatment(s) in total ACB score
secondary_outcome.description: The attribution of antimuscarinics for OAB treatment to entire anticholinergic exposures in OAB patients.

arm_group.description: Subjects who have dispensing records for treatment of overactive bladder will be included
Subjects who do not have dispensing records for treatment of overactive bladder will be included

intervention.description: Overview of anticholinergic burden, rather than to evaluate specific drugs

study_pop.textblock: Australian and Korean with at least one prescription of any treatment between January 22, 2016 (For Korea: January 1st, 2016) and December 31, 2016 derived from country claims data.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have at least one dispensing of any medication between January 22, 2016 and December 31, 2016.
Inclusion Criteria for Korea:
- Have at least one dispensing of any medication between January 1st, 2016 and December 31, 2016.
- Participant was diagnosed with OAB (ICD-10 N32.8, N31.0, N31.1, N31.2, N31.8, N31.9, N32.9, N39.8 and N39.40) at index date.
- Participant did not have dispensing record of an OAB medication during the washout period (6 months prior to the index date).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who do not have a complete year of data availability in the database prior to index date.
- Have record of hospitalization on the index date.
Exclusion Criteria for Korea:
- Participant was hospitalized on the index date.
- Participant did not have an active insurance status during the washout period or on the index date.
- Participant received onabotulinumtoxin A and/or surgical intervention as part of the OAB treatment during the washout period.
- Participant was diagnosed with stress incontinence (ICD-10 N39.3 or equivalent) or had dispensing record of medication for stress incontinence (duloxetine) during the washout period.
- Participant was diagnosed with urinary tract infection (ICD-10 N30.0 and N39.0 or equivalent) during the washout period or on the index date.

patient_data.ipd_description: Access to anonymized individual participant level data will not be provided for this trial as it meets one or more of the exceptions described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com under "Sponsor Specific Details for Astellas.
